solution.text:
side opposite to angle(p)=_{{12*j}}_cm=perpendicular
tanP=\(perpendicular\over base\)
Angle(P)=30 degree, tan(30)=\(1\over \sqrt3\)
therefore, base=\(_{{12*j}}_\sqrt3\)
sin(p)=\(perpendicular\over hypotenuse\)
sin(30)=\(\frac 12\)=\(_{{12*j}}_\over hypotenuse\)
hence the longest side, hypotenuse=\(_{{12*j*2}}_cm\)

content.text:
In a triangle PQR right-angled at Q, it is given that the side opposite to the angle(P)=30 is _{{12*j}}_cm.
Find the longest side of the triangle.
